comments:
Build: I20030129

I was using Ctrl+, and Ctrl+. to cycle between problems in a java editor.  The
TaskList was a hidden fast view at the time.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.tasklist.TaskList.setSelection(TaskList.java:1213)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor.gotoError(JavaEditor.java:2090)

org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:845)

i tried for a while to reproduce this problem without success. the line number 
in the stack trace isn't helpful either, because its not even in that method, 
and there hasn't been changes to TaskList.java since you logged this bug. let 
me know if you get a repeat of this.

Looking at the version of TaskList in that build (revision 1.13), it shows that
line 1213 is the last line of the setSelection method:

	viewer.setSelection(selection, reveal);

So, the viewer was null.  There must be some way a view can be instantiated but
not have its createPartControl method executed.
ok. i'll check that out, and at least protect against an NPE there..
possible that it might have been called. added 'if (viewer != null) {..}'
